attributes.title: UMB Group 6 Example
attributes.description:
Crown Trophy Supply Chain for UMass Boston MBA Program
MBA MS 635 Summer II 2013
The raw materials needed to make plastic are added to a machine that heats them to up to allow for proper creation of plastic pellets. These pellets are then shipped to a molding factory.
attributes.title: Making Plastic

attributes.description:
At this point all of the parts arrive to the store. Depending on the size and complexity of the order production may start right away or be delayed while other parts arrive.

For the most part some inventory is kept on site so smaller orders can be accommodated almost immediately. Larger orders can take anywhere from 2 weeks to 2 months depending on availability of part and staff.
attributes.title: Trophy Store

attributes.description:
As part of the process to make a trophy a stand has to be made. For purposes of weight and looks many trophy makes turn to either wood or marble. In the case of our company they choose to make the base of the trophy either from White or Black marble depending on the desires of the customer. 

Several different quarries in Italy work to supply Crown Awards with the marble. Each piece is cut to general specifications before shipping
attributes.address: Via Carrara Nazzano, 73, 54033 Carrara Massa and Carrara, Italy
attributes.title: Marble Harvesting
Final Engraving
attributes.description:
For most orders plates will be attached to front of the marble base. These plates are sheets of metal with an adhesive on the back. A fine point laser engraving machine will etch in requested engraving to complete the trophy making process.

(for mapping purposes they are separated, when in reality both tasks take place in the same shop)

attributes.title: Steel Factory
attributes.address: Michigan 123, Hiawatha National Forest, Moran, MI 49760, USA
attributes.description: A steel mill melts down iron ore to create steel. This forging process will create the nuts, bolts, and connector rods that will hold all of the parts of the trophy together.

attributes.title: Molding of Toppers
attributes.description: After the needed plastic pellets arrive from the prior factory, workers will begin melting them down into a liquid that can be injected into molds. These molds are the "Toppers" for the trophies. They can range anywhere in size from 1-12 inches and take a variety of shapes ranging from a soccer ball to a baseball batter hitting a home run to a student accepting an award.

attributes.title: Molding of Toppers to Trophy Store
Making Plastic to Molding of Toppers
